definitions.definition: Position or reputation in society or a profession .
examples: He does not have much of a standing as a chemist.

definitions.definition: The act of a person who stands, or a place where someone stands.
The position of a team in a league or of a player in a list .
examples: After their last win, their standing went up three places.

definitions.definition: Room in which to park a vehicle or vehicles
The right of a party to bring a legal action , based on the relationship between that party and the matter to which the action relates.
examples: He may be insulting, a miserable rotter and a fool, but unless he slanders or libels you, or damages your property, you do not have standing to sue him.

definitions.definition: The location on a street where a market trader habitually operates.

main_definition: ( figurative ) Position or reputation in society or a profession .
secondary_definitions: The act of a person who stands, or a place where someone stands.
( sports ) The position of a team in a league or of a player in a list .
( British ) Room in which to park a vehicle or vehicles
( law ) The right of a party to bring a legal action , based on the relationship between that party and the matter to which the action relates.
( UK , slang , obsolete ) The location on a street where a market trader habitually operates.
